description: Conversion of the upper floor levels (first and second floor) above the existing public house (basement and ground floor) into four self-contained residential units; associated internal and external alterations to ground floor level to provide residential access; and provision of cycle spaces and refuse storage
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number(s): 0103-DR-0010 P01 Existing Site Location Plan, 0103-DR-0011 P01 Existing Site Block Plan, 0103-DR-0012 P01 Existing Basement Floor Plan, 0103-DR-0013 P01 Existing Ground Floor Plan, 0103-DR-0014 P01 Existing First Floor Plan, 0103-DR-0015 P01 Existing Second Floor Plan, 0103-DR-0016 P01 Existing Roof Plan, 0103-DR-0020 P01 Existing South Elevation, 0103-DR-0021 P01 Existing East Elevation, 0103-DR-0022 P01 Existing West Elevation, 0103-DR-0023 P01 Existing North Elevation, 0103-DR-0030 P01 Existing Section AA, 0103-DR-0031 P01 Existing Section BB, 0103-DR-0032 P01 Existing Section CC, 0103-DR-0100 P03 Proposed Basement Floor Plan, 0103-DR-0101 P02 Proposed Ground Floor Plan, 0103-DR-0102 P02 Proposed First Floor Plan, 0103-DR-0103 P02 Proposed Second Floor Plan, 0103-DR-0104 P02 Proposed Roof Plan, 0103-DR-0200 P02 Proposed South Elevation, 0103-DR-0201 P02 Proposed East Elevation, 0103-DR-0202 P02 Proposed West Elevation, 0103-DR-0203 P02 Proposed North Elevation, 0103-DR-0300 P02 Proposed Section AA, 0103-DR-0301 P02 Proposed Section BB, 0103-DR-0302 P02 Proposed Section CC, Viability Study prepared by Savills dated 5 June 2018, Design and Access Statement prepared by Kruszelnicki Leetch Architects

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, in the interest of proper planning. | All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building and those indicated in the approved plans.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4, 7B and 7C of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4, 7.6 and 7.8 of the London Plan (2016) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2018). | Cycle storage shall be provided prior to the first occupation of the development permitted in accordance with the details approved under Condition 2 of this permission and retained permanently. Cycle parking shall comply with the London Cycling Design Standards.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area and in the interests of the future occupants of the development and to provide adequate facilities for cyclists in accordance with policies with policies 3.5 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), and policies 5.16 and 6.9 of the London Plan (2016). | Refuse and recycling storage shall be provided prior to the first occupation of the development permitted and retained permanently in accordance with the details approved under Condition 2 of this permission.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area and in the interests of the future occupants of the development in accordance with policies with policies 3.5 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), and policy 5.16 of the London Plan (2016). | Sound insulation measures between the pub and dwellings above to the upper floors outlined within the Acoustic Noise Impact Assessment report by KP Acoustics hereby approved, shall be implemented prior to the occupation of the residential units and thereafter retained permanently.

Reason: To protect the living conditions future occupiers of the development from noise within the public house, in accordance with policies 7B and 7D of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013) and policy 7.15 of the London Plan (2016). | The external sound level emitted from plant, machinery and equipment at the development shall be lower than the lowest existing background sound level by at least 5dBA as measured at/ calculated to the nearest and/or most affected noise sensitive premises in order to prevent any adverse impact. The assessment shall be made in accordance with BS4142:2014, with all machinery operating together at maximum capacity.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site and surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise from mechanical installations/ equipment, in accordance with policies 7B and 7D of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013) and policy 7.15 of the London Plan (2016). | The hours of operation for the public house activity shall be limited to the following hours:
All activity shall cease 30 minutes after closing.

Reason: To accord with the terms of the application and preserve and maintain the amenities of occupiers of neighbouring residential properties, in accordance with policy 7.15 of the London Plan (2016), policies 1.1 (j) of the adopted Ealing's Development (Core) Strategy 2026 and policy 7A of the adopted Ealing's Development Management Document (2013). | The hours of operation and use by patrons for the public house external amenity area shall be limited to the following hours:
All activity shall cease 30 minutes after closing.

Reason: To accord with the terms of the application and preserve and maintain the amenities of occupiers of neighbouring residential properties, in accordance with policy 7.15 of the London Plan (2016), policies 1.1 (j) of the adopted Ealing's Development (Core) Strategy 2026 and policy 7A of the adopted Ealing's Development Management Document (2013).
